sub_title: Associated Researcher @ ISS Erasmus | PhD in Development Economics. MA in Public Policies. Bach in Sociology.
summary:
As an Associated Researcher at the International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam, I leverage my PhD in Development Economics and 20+ years of experience as a Sociology and Political Economy researcher to create opportunities and promote social and economic inclusion rights for vulnerable populations. My mission is to address the challenges and opportunities of development and social change, especially in contexts of humanitarian emergencies and crises.

In my current role, I advise and evaluate educational, social, and economic policies in Venezuela and Latin America, using conventional and unconventional impact indicators for results-based management. I have also supervised and managed teams, negotiated with various stakeholders, and delivered explanatory lectures and documents in multicultural settings. I have extensive skills and experience in designing, conducting, and analyzing qualitative and quantitative research using tools such as MS Office, SPSS, ArcView, and MapInfo. I am fluent in English, French, and Spanish and have a working knowledge of Portuguese, German, and Dutch.
